text: Push the ball to destroy the obstacles and clear a path

title: Mission Description
content: After returning from theAbyss, we split into two groups.Phainonand I headed to assist the battle-wornMydei, while (Trailblazer) planned to harnessOronyx's power to gather the memory fragments. Once this was done, we would devise a plan to journey into Castrum Kremnos' past, where we would join forces with Castorice to destroy Nikador's immortal body.

text: (Investigate the barrier)
Obstacles are blocking the path... Maybe the ball on the second floor can be utilized to break the box.
Go to the place in Castrum Kremnos that serves as the link to the past
The three of you rush into Castrum Kremnos and arrive at the arena
(Approach the door)

speaker: Castorice
line: ...How can we go back to the past?

speaker: Mem
line: Come, follow!

speaker: Mem
line: Memory... Scent, strong!

text: (Enter the large room)

speaker: Castorice
line: That battle cry... Is that Lord Mydei?

text: (Approach stairs leading to the marked location)

speaker: Castorice
line: Nikador ... They're still locked in battle.

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Castorice
line: The battle is still raging... I can feel the intensity even from here.

text: I wish I could go and help them...

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ▶ I understand how you feel, ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer). But right now, we must head to another battlefield.

text: We have our own battle to face.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Exactly. We'll only be able to help them once we've seen our own mission through.

text: At least we know they're still alive.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: We'll only be able to help them once we've seen our own mission through.

speaker: Mem
line: Here, memory, complete. Give me, fragments.

speaker: Mem
line: Past... I, recreate.

text: Hand over the memory fragments to Mem
(Talk to Mem)

speaker: Mem
line: Memory, complete. Give me, fragments.

speaker: Mem
line: Past... Recreate, I will.

text: (SubmitBard's Memory Fragment,Chartonus' Memory Fragment,Damionis' Memory Fragment)

speaker: Mem
line: Fragments, complete. Memory... appear.

speaker: Mem
line: Past, entrance... Open!

speaker: Castorice
line: Is that the gate to the past?

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ Let's go, ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer). We will unravel Nikador 's secrets together.

text: Walk through the door to the past in Castrum Kremnos

speaker: Castorice
line: Castrum Kremnos...

speaker: Castorice
line: So this is how it looked like before Aquila closed their eyes.

text: Where should we start searching?
What a magnificent sight.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: The City of Warriors, its magnificence certainly lives up to its name.

speaker: Castorice
line: We should first figure out which era we've traveled back to.

speaker: Castorice
line: The memory fragments we gathered for Mem all point toward the final stage of the Chrysos War ... We might be able to use that as a starting point for our deductions.

text: But we can just ask around!

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ...We may draw suspicion this way. Castrum Kremnos is no leisure spot for tourists. We shouldn't draw unnecessary attention to ourselves.

text: Ooh, so this is what it feels like to be a time traveler?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: It's... quite intriguing, indeed. But Castrum Kremnos is no leisure spot for tourists. We shouldn't draw unnecessary attention to ourselves.

speaker: Castorice
line: Let's start with the city's surroundings. We might be able to gather some clues by listening and observing.

text: Head to Castrum Kremnos of yesteryear

title: Step Description
content: (Trailblazer) unlocked the door to the past in Castrum Kremnos, stepping into the city's former days. It was the time of the Kremnos Festival, and Nikador had just begun to lose their mind. Castrum Kremnos was still prosperous and vibrant with life.

speaker: Castorice
line: Under all this resplendence... is the distinct stench of death.

speaker: Castorice
line: But even the most magnificent of deaths can never be sweet...

text: (Approach the marked person)

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Hello?

text: Anyone home?
Heellooo!
Is he hard of hearing?

speaker: Silent Gladiator
line: ...What is it?

speaker: Castorice
line: ...May I ask if you're here to join the competition?

speaker: Silent Gladiator
line: Competition...?

speaker: Silent Gladiator
line: No... I have no interest in meaningless sports.

speaker: Castorice
line: So... you're here for Nikador 's festival?

speaker: Silent Gladiator
line: Utterly foolish...

text: What a cranky guy...

speaker: Castorice
line: War has left its mark on many from this period, so please don't take it personally...

text: Examine the area surrounding the arena to confirm the era you're in
(Try to proceed before going to the marked locations)

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ Please wait, ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer). It's best not to go there yet...

speaker: Castorice
line: Let's try to find more clues around here first.

text: (Listen to the group of people)

speaker: Resentful Kremnoan
line: Crown prince? Chrysos Heir ? What a joke!

speaker: Resentful Kremnoan
line: Mydeimos is just a coward! Those who deserted Kremnos with him have brought shame upon the Lance of Fury ... Despicable traitors will never bask in glory again!

speaker: Concerned Kremnoan
line: But Mydeimos is undoubtedly the mightiest warrior among us... Who else can we turn to now that he's gone?

speaker: Resentful Kremnoan
line: What nonsense are you spouting? King Eurypon , the rightful ruler of Castrum Kremnos, has not fallen! He still stands firm in this city and has never given up on awakening the great Titan.

speaker: Resentful Kremnoan
line: As long as we remain steadfast at his side, we'll reclaim our former glory and sow bloodshed and conquest amongst our foes...

speaker: Castorice
line: King Eurypon...?

speaker: Castorice
line: Right, of course... The people of this time wouldn't know the fate of that old king yet.

text: What fate?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ...He was killed by Lord Mydei.

text: Mydeimos... is a deserter?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: No... I don't believe that Lord Mydei left out of cowardice. It was, in fact, a courageous choice.

text: Those people sound furious.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: They are entitled to that rage... because Lord Mydei was once the hero of Castrum Kremnos.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: But he did not leave out of cowardice... It was, in fact, a courageous choice.

speaker: Castorice
line: With that, we should have enough to determine the time period we are currently in.

text: (Examine the scroll)

speaker: Castorice
line: It's a scroll written in the common tongue. We should see what it's about.

text: (Quick Read)

children.text: Five Great Virtues and Festival Notice

Festival Notice At the Action Hour in the Month of ███████, Day █, Kremnos Arena will hold a grand ceremony in commemoration of Nikador, and pray for Castrum Kremnos' prosperity, honing the battle souls of our folk, so that all may bask in the radiant glory of the Strife Titan's Five Great Virtues: Unfearing of blade at the throat, manifesting the visage of courage Unyielding to conniving treachery, protecting the crown of honor Unblinking of eyes burning bright, upholding the cornerstone of reason Unbending from wounds to flesh, forging characters of tenacity Undaunted of risking life to protect, embodying corpus of sacrifice. In the spirit of this gladiatorial festival, its warriors are all beacons of valor from all corners of Castrum Kremnos. The arena is in a wide open space — warriors can don sturdy armor and wield sharp lances, marching on a path of onslaught to finally face King Eurypon. Victors will seize fame, their names etched in glory, and the defeated will become fallen souls of heroes, unshaken in their pursuit of courage. The festival is a raucous affair, eagerly awaiting a surge of warriors who jostle to pledge themselves to call forth the divinity of the Titans . May Nikador defend Kremnos for eternity!

speaker: Castorice
line: Courage, Honor, Reason, Tenacity, Sacrifice...

speaker: Castorice
line: Nikador did live up to these values in his prime, but now...

speaker: Castorice
line: Kremnos seems to be hosting a festival, where its victor can go on to have an audience with the ruler and be bestowed with honor. It's just as Mr. Damionis described.

speaker: Castorice
line: If we can pose as participants, we might be able to get into the city...

text: (ObtainFive Great Virtues and Festival Notice
(Talk to the weapon merchant)

speaker: Weapon Merchant
line: Finest weapons for sale! Come take a look! The sharpest blades in all of Kremnos!

speaker: Weapon Merchant
line: Gladiator swords, maces, and bucklers crafted by the Grand Craftsman Chartonus himself!

speaker: Weapon Merchant
line: Looking to breeze through your foes at the Kremnos Festival? I've got the best weapons right here for you!

text: Not getting much business, huh?

children.speaker: Weapon Merchant
children.line: Hmph... Those boorish warriors know nothing about quality gear!

text: Are these really crafted by Chartonus?

children.speaker: Weapon Merchant
children.line: I'm as honest a merchant as they come! Those boorish warriors know nothing about quality gear!

speaker: Weapon Merchant
line: Ah, but you're not like them! With your air of sophistication, you must be a noble from one of the grand city-states, right? Here, let me show you what I have in stock...

text: (Look at Castorice.)
Could this be a scam?

speaker: Castorice
line: The craftsmanship of a weapon reveals the time period it's made... We can afford to take a quick look.

text: (If something was purchased)

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ▶ ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer)... Much as we're in a memory of the past, impulse buying is still an undesirable behavior.

children.speaker: Weapon Merchant
children.line: Wahaha, you're quite the high-roller! Thank you, and please come again!

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ▶ May I take a look at that weapon, ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer)?

text: (If nothing was purchased)

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ▶ I thought you'd be the kind to make impulsive purchases, ( Mr. / Miss. ) (Trailblazer), but you've certainly proven me wrong.

children.speaker: Weapon Merchant
children.line: Tsk. So you're just window shopping? What a waste of my time...

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Mister, can I please have a look at the weapon you're holding on to?

children.speaker: Weapon Merchant
children.line: Oh? A gentle lady like you taking an interest in weapons? Why, of course! Please, feel free to take a closer look!

text: Castorice carefully takes the weapon in her hand and examines it closely for a moment...

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ ...I've seen enough. Let's go, ( Mr. / Miss. ) (Trailblazer).

speaker: Weapon Merchant
line: Leaving already? Don't you want to browse through my other wares?

speaker: Weapon Merchant
line: Well then, come back anytime... if you make it through the festival today.

text: What's wrong with that weapon?
What was that just now?

speaker: Castorice
line: Those weapons reek of blood. He made an effort to conceal it, but traces of death aren't something you can easily erase... I shudder to even consider where he got his goods from.

speaker: Castorice
line: He didn't lie about the weapon being one of Chartonus' handiwork, though. Thanks to its inscription, I now have a fairly good guess of the time period we're in.

text: (Talk to the weapon merchant again, optional)

speaker: Weapon Merchant
line: Finest weapons for sale! Come take a look! The sharpest blades in all of Kremnos!

text: (Once all three locations have been examined)

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ Let's run through everything we know so far, ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer)

speaker: Castorice
line: Lord Mydei has gone to seek refuge in Okhema with some of his people . Old King Eurypon still reigns, though Nikador has fallen into a slumber. And Castrum Kremnos is now gathering warriors from all over in preparation for their festival...

speaker: Castorice
line: It seems that we've traveled back to the last years of the Chrysos War, a time when Castrum Kremnos grappled with both internal strife and the Titan's waning divinity.

text: Do you have a plan in mind?
Talk is cheap. Let's charge in!

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: That's too risky of a plan. And I might even become a burden to you.

text: It's about time you used your powers.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: I... can't control my strength with that much precision, the risk is too great.

speaker: Castorice
line: The safest bet is to play by the rules. They happen to be hosting a festival in the city... We can try entering as participants?

speaker: Castorice
line: Let's make our way into the city first, we can then wait for the right opportunity to strike. When it comes down to it... I will take care of Nikador 's kin.

speaker: Castorice
line: That should be the place to sign up.

text: Go to the registration area to join the competition

title: Step Description
content: To execute their plan as safely as possible, Castorice and (Trailblazer) decided to blend into the festival celebration, forming a trio with a silent warrior and venturing deeper into Castrum Kremnos.

text: (Approach the marked person)

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: ...Such a pity! Those three warriors were so close to completing the trial, to emerging as victorious Kremnoan warriors, and to earning an audience with our glorious King Eurypon!

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: And yet, they collapsed at the final hurdle! The Furiae Praetor swiftly hacked them down, reducing them to mere mincemeat... May Nikador recognize their valor and embrace their heroic spirits.

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: ...Next! Do we have any more warriors ready for the challenge? King Eurypon awaits, longing for the first brave soul to survive and stand before him!

text: This competition sounds pretty brutal...
Is this competition really that hardcore?

speaker: Castorice
line: This was a time when life was valued far less than bread. People hardly bat their eyelids at the savagery and death that had become commonplace.

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: Does no one have the courage to take up the challenge? Are you not prepared to wager your glory and set your lives ablaze under the splendor of Kremnos?

speaker: Silent Gladiator
line: ...Let me through.

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: Why, it's you again, inarticulate fool! Pfft, unarmed, and yet you dare to think you can join the Kremnos Festival? That's an insult to the Lance of Fury !

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: I've told you before—this is a trial for three! This is a trial that requires three people! If you can't even gather enough comrades to stand by you in life and death, it's time you went home and took up herding!

speaker: Silent Gladiator
line: ...Let me through.

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: Hmph, so you're not just inarticulate, but also hard of hearing... Keep up this act of nuisance, and I'll be sure to show you how uncivil we can get!

speaker: Castorice
line: Teams of three...

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer), this might be our chance...! We can enter the city with him.

text: Sign me up!
We'll be his teammates!

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: Hm? Who are...

speaker: Silent Gladiator
line: ...You two.

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: Pfft... I see what this is.

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: As you wish! Good for you, you now have allies to court death with. Come on up here, fool!

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: The adrenaline-pumping scenes are becoming a bit tiresome, so adding a wildly mismatched "interlude" would make for a refreshing change and spice things up.

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: Let the trial begin, then! Your only goal is to survive! As long as you still hold the breath of life, you'll either triumph over every trial and claim worldly glory — or leave your soul in Kremnos to become fuel for Strife!

text: The stakes are high...
I'm not sure about this...

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ Have faith, ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer)... Lord Phainon and Lord Mydei are still fighting. We must match their unwavering resolve.

speaker: Silent Gladiator
line: ...Can we enter now?

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: Eager to meet your demise? Very well then, let the trial begin!

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: Give me your names, warriors.

text: (Trailblazer).

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Castorice.

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: ...Gnaeus.

children.speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
children.line: ▶ Castorice, Gnaeus, and (Trailblazer)...

text: I am the Galactic Baseballer!

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Castorice.

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: ...Gnaeus.

children.speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
children.line: Galactic Baseballer, Castorice, and Gnaeus...

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: It is an honor to see your true faces revealed by the radiant glow of The Blade of Fury.

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: In the name of the five virtues of Nikador — courage, honor, reason, tenacity, and sacrifice — stride through the holy city's gate and embrace your fate.

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: May your courageous souls satisfy Nikador and fuel the conquests of Kremnos.

text: Enter the Castrum Kremnos
(Speak to the registration officer again, optional)

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: In the name of the five virtues of Nikador , stride through the holy city's gate and embrace your fate.

speaker: Kremnos Registration Officer
line: May your courageous souls satisfy Nikador and fuel the conquests of Kremnos.

text: (Approach the gate)

speaker: Castorice
line: Lord Gnaeus, may I ask what is it you are fighting for?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Fighting needs no reason. I seek only to crush foolishness.

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Castorice
line: They have fewer guards than I expected. I thought we'd be greeted with something more... intense.

text: Observing formalities before aggression, now that's a thoughtful approach.
Do these battle-hardened people also have a taste for puzzles?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Meaningless...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Why stall those charging for Death's door?

speaker: Castorice
line: Death is not part of our plan, Lord Gnaeus. We should work on solving the puzzle they've set for us.

speaker: Castorice
line: Look, there are two braziers on that wall. Could they be... some sort of hint?

speaker: Castorice
line: And those mechanisms protruding from the ground... Should we attempt to activate them?

speaker: Castorice
line: A Prophecy Tablet...

speaker: Castorice
line: Let's make use of the tools here to solve the puzzle.

text: There seems to be a pressure plate mechanism in the middle of the hole. Perhaps the weight of the ball can trigger it and activate something...? There seems to be a pressure plate mechanism in the middle of the hole. Perhaps the weight of the ball can trigger it and activate something...?
Ignite the fire pit and complete the trial
(Investigate the exit)

speaker: Castorice
line: Is this the exit? Oh, it's locked.

speaker: Castorice
line: Let's focus on igniting the braziers first.

text: (Solve the prophecy tablet, triggering the pressure mechanism)

speaker: Castorice
line: Look, we lit the brazier.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: You seem quite familiar with these... devices.

speaker: Castorice
line: Huh? They're all over Amphoreus .

text: (Approach shrine)

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Oronyx ...

speaker: Castorice
line: What's wrong, Lord Gnaeus?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Weak. Reduced to a servant of humans.

text: (Approach ball that requires a longer rewind time)

The bases of some Ball-Holder Statues have a rotating mechanism, identifiable by the presence of a glowing blue pattern at their base connection. For these statues, you can adjust their orientation from the back to direct the ball to roll in different directions. The bases of some Ball-Holder Statues have a rotating mechanism, identifiable by the presence of a glowing blue pattern at their base connection. For these statues, you can adjust their orientation from the back to direct the ball to roll in different directions.
(Trigger the second pressure mechanism)

speaker: Castorice
line: The gate has opened, as expected.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: A meaningless challenge to erode the patience of warriors.

text: (After defeating enemies)

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Crumble, weakling.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: The Titan's creations? When did they become so weak...?

speaker: Castorice
line: Rest in peace...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: A dreamless sleep is nothing but deathly silence.

text: (Optional) Discuss other ways to pass with Gnaeus
(Talk to Gnaeus)

speaker: Gnaeus
line: A meaningless challenge to erode the patience of warriors.

text: Progress forward in the way of Kremnos! (Skip puzzle)

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: Let's see what you can do.

children.text:
(Begin battle againstFuriae Archer×2,Furiae Troupe×1,Furiae Warrior×1
(Wave 2:Furiae Warrior×2,Furiae Archer×2,Furiae Philosopher×1)
(Immediately completes the puzzle and triggers associated dialogue)

text: No worries, let me ponder on it a bit more...

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: ...Don't push yourself.

text: Proceed deeper into Castrum Kremnos and search for clues about Nikador
(Approach the marked location)

speaker: Castorice
line: Barricades... We must find a way to remove them.

speaker: Castorice
line: Could it be a challenge that requires us to use the Hand of Zagreus? Let's get closer and find out.

text: Clear the obstacles using the Hand of Zagreus
(Engage the Hand of Zagreus)

The Hand of Zagreus can charge up, and then sprint in a straight line, during which it will gain a certain degree of destructive power. The Hand of Zagreus can charge up, and then sprint in a straight line, during which it will gain a certain degree of destructive power. Hit the Punch ability button to enter the aiming state. During this time, the Hand of Zagreus cannot move . Drag the screen and adjust the direction, and hit the Punch ability button to perform a Punch Action , whereby the Hand of Zagreus will sprint toward the aimed direction. During the sprint, the Hand of Zagreus cannot be controlled . Hit the Punch ability button to enter the aiming state. During this time, the Hand of Zagreus cannot move . Drag the screen and adjust the direction, and hit the Punch ability button to perform a Punch Action , whereby the Hand of Zagreus will sprint toward the aimed direction. During the sprint, the Hand of Zagreus cannot be controlled . While in the aiming state, the Hand of Zagreus can detect destructible objects that glow. Sprint at the destructible object to destroy it. Upon collision, the Hand of Zagreus will stop sprinting . While in the aiming state, the Hand of Zagreus can detect destructible objects that glow. Sprint at the destructible object to destroy it. Upon collision, the Hand of Zagreus will stop sprinting .
(After punching with the Hand of Zagreus)

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Zagreus , the embodiment of all things despicable.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Their legacy reduced to mere playthings for humans...

speaker: Castorice
line: This is a lot more destructive than I expected...

speaker: Castorice
line: Was this giant hand really used for thievery in the past?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: ...Crumble to dust.

text: (After all obstacles have been cleared)

speaker: Castorice
line: The way ahead is now clear.

speaker: Castorice
line: Lord Gnaeus, before we move on... there is something we must explain to you.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: ...Hm. You're not here for this foolish competition.

speaker: Castorice
line: How did you...?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: You've been fighting to suppress your true thoughts within you all this while... You cannot deceive me.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: I know you have no care for that fatuous king's contrived glory. You can keep your motive to yourselves, so long as you stay out of my way...

text: So, what is your motive?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: I've said it before: To obliterate the deeply entrenched roots of foolishness within Castrum Kremnos.

speaker: Castorice
line: Now the true challenge begins... This is where it gets difficult.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Meaningless forestalling. They are meant to taste defeat on the battlefield. Deter us further... and I shall send them to Thanatos .

text: Proceed deeper into Castrum Kremnos and search for clues about Nikador
(After defeating enemies)

line: Hmph, these goons are much tougher than they seem...
Wahaha, it's my lucky day...
What a fine weapon! It's a real beauty...
With a bit of sprucing up, no one will guess it's second-hand, heh...

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Gnaeus
line: ...Wait.

text: Got a crick in your back?
No can do, I'm already itching to fight!

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ▶ Please keep it together, ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer).

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Hush... Listen.
Heh heheh...
Looks like I've hit the jackpot this time...

speaker: Castorice
line: I hear it now. That's...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Pretend you did not hear anything. Act oblivious.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: We'll find a way to make him come out of hiding.

text: Investigate the strange human voice
(Continue up the stairs)

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Stop at the next turn.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: If there's an assassin... we'll take care of him right there.

text: (Approach the marked location)
The three held their breath at the corner, waiting for the voice behind them to approach...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Keep quiet...
*pant* They sure are quick on their feet. One bag won't be enough to hold everything...
After this haul, I shouldn't have to scrounge for leftovers for the next few days. If only this festival could go on longer...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: ...Now.

speaker: Weapon Merchant
line: Huh!?

text: Gah!
Huh?
It's you!

speaker: Castorice
line: ...That's why all of your weapons reek of blood.

speaker: Weapon Merchant
line: Uh... ahem, well... I can explain myself! You see, I—

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Looting the arena like a despicable lowlife... Prepare to meet Thanatos , thief.

speaker: Weapon Merchant
line: No! Stop!

speaker: Castorice
line: Don't do it, Lord Gnaeus!

speaker: Castorice
line: This isn't right. Please... let him go.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Turn around, girl. Look at the corpses of those we crushed. You can cut down warriors without a second thought, yet you show compassion to this scum?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Give me a reason... show me you're not as dumb as those ignorant fools.

speaker: Castorice
line: Because... he still knows how to fear death. Despicable or scum he may be, but he doesn't deserve to die here, nor become a sacrifice to the Hand of Shadow .

speaker: Castorice
line: It is the darkest force in this world, and if left unchecked... all light will be consumed.

speaker: Castorice
line: To answer your question, it is never the desire to kill that drives me to wield a sword, but rather, the fear of death.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: ...Get lost, scum. Consider yourself lucky today.

speaker: Weapon Merchant
line: Th—Thank you! Y—You won't see me around this city again, I promise!

speaker: Castorice
line: Your mercy is appreciated, Lord Gnaeus.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Make no mistake. This is simply a commendation for your courage, not a sign that I agree with your ideas.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: If I understand you correctly, you must have overcome tremendous fear to dare to stand in the way of my sword.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: This trial isn't over... We should keep going.

text: Proceed deeper into Castrum Kremnos and search for clues about Nikador
(Approach the marked location)

speaker: Castorice
line: It's the same mechanism... We need to ignite the two braziers to unlock the way forward.

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ Let's clear this trial together, ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer).

text: Ignite the fire pit and complete the trial
(Light one brazier)

speaker: Castorice
line: One more to go.

text: (Approach the right side of the puzzle)

speaker: Castorice
line: The platform on the right is missing an iron ball...

speaker: Castorice
line: Do we have to summon a miracle for it to appear?

text: (Approach a broken platform in the puzzle, optional depending on how it is solved)

speaker: Gnaeus
line: The bridge ahead is broken. How do we get across?

speaker: Castorice
line: Let's try illuminating it with the Oronyx Orb.

text: (Invesstigate block that appears after using Tome of Miracles, optional)

speaker: Gnaeus
line: An exquisite stone... It's a shame it appeared somewhere it doesn't belong.

speaker: Castorice
line: We may be able to temporarily remove it with the orb?

text: (Light the second brazier)

speaker: Castorice
line: That... should have done it, right?

text: (Once both braziers are lit but the room is not in the correct time dimension to open the gate)‍[Does this line play if you solve the right puzzle before the left?]

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ Let's recover the miracle from the tome, ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer).

text: (Attempt to exit while in the wrong time dimension)

speaker: Castorice
line: The gate won't budge in this time dimension... How about recovering the "miracle" from the tome?

text: (Optional) Discuss other ways to pass with Gnaeus
(Talk to Gnaeus)

speaker: Gnaeus
line: A meaningless challenge to erode the patience of warriors.

text: Progress forward in the way of Kremnos! (Skip puzzle)

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: Let's see what you can do.

children.text:
(Begin battle againstFuriae Archer×1,Furiae Praetor×1,Furiae Troupe×1}
(Immediately completes the puzzle and triggers associated dialogue)

text: No worries, let me ponder on it a bit more...

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: ...Don't push yourself.

text: Proceed deeper into Castrum Kremnos and search for clues about Nikador
(Step onto elevator)

speaker: Castorice
line: Are there others who made it this far...?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Never underestimate those who step into this arena. They are skilled and courageous beyond measure.

text: (Head down the hallway)

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: Brave one... Step forth...

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: I sense... a rare aura around you...

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: You could well be... Castrum Kremnos' salvation...

speaker: Castorice
line: Is that statue... beckoning to us?

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: Brave one... O Brave one! Come closer... Let me get a good look at you...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Are you calling out to me, lion?

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: That's right... I am. You have an unusual aura about you... I have not seen such a blazing soul in a very long time.

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: The blazing star of Castrum Kremnos has drifted far from us... all that remains is a dim candle, on the verge of being extinguished.

text: Blazing star...
...Is that Mydei?

speaker: Castorice
line: I think... you're right.

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: The aging and feeble king is plotting something unspeakable... One that seeks to defile Nikador 's divinity, their soul, and the legacy they left to Kremnos.

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: We need salvation... we need a champion to reignite our hope.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: ...I did not come to save anybody, old lion. I am here to answer a call... to crush greed and foolishness once and for all.

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: Perhaps... that's what we desperately need.

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: Forge on then, warrior... heed the call. I am elderly... and weary... but I shall watch you depart and pray for victory in every battle encounter...

text: (Continue down the hallway)

speaker: Castorice
line: Lord Gnaeus, the calling you're heeding...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Comes from the depths of this city. We're close... so close, in fact, that I can hear the whispers in my ears.

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Castorice
line: Such carnage... whose desires does this festival truly serve?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: A beast that has lost sight of its target and is now guided only by its innate bloodlust.

speaker: Castorice
line: Lord Gnaeus, now that we're at the very heart of Castrum Kremnos... it's time to let you in on our goal here.

speaker: Castorice
line: While we do not expect you to work with us, we do not wish for conflict either.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: ...Speak.

speaker: Castorice
line: We came here to find a way to destroy Nikador . We received... intel that the Titan of Strife had lost their reason and is now trying to create an immortal vessel for themself.

speaker: Castorice
line: If we do not stop them now, they will pose a grave danger to the future generations of Amphoreus.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Hmph, grave danger, you say...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Our goals are not in conflict, girl. Find the Titan and we can both get what we came for.

text: What about the festival?

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: Better off forgotten.

text: Will we have to battle them...?

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: I smell fear... You're scared?

speaker: Castorice
line: The souls of the sacrificed are still wandering this hall... I hear their endless bemoaning, their senseless deaths have left them wronged, their mournful wails echo endlessly.

speaker: Castorice
line: Perhaps I can learn something from their cries...

text: Speak with the wondering spirit with the help of Castorice

title: Step Description
content: Castorice reveals the true purpose of our mission to Gnaeus, the silent gladiator. The party presses on, gathering information on the way, vowing to return Nikador's five soul fragments to their rightful place to prevent the creation of their immortal divine body, and to reforge the glory of the Strife Titan.

text: (Approached marked location)

speaker: Castorice
line: Reveal yourself, O warrior spirit... I know that you have yet to rest.

speaker: Castorice
line: I ask for you to guide us. Let us see what you once gazed upon, let us hear what your ears once heard...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: You can rouse the dead?

speaker: Castorice
line: No... I can only summon souls that haven't fully passed on.

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Castorice
line: O, ye who cannot rest in peace... Tell us, what have you heard?

speaker: Soldier's Echo
line: "Do we really just leave them like that? The putrid stench of decay here is almost too much to bear."

speaker: Priest's Echo
line: "Yes. Didn't you hear? This is part of the ritual. We need to offer up sacrifices to the Titan."

speaker: Soldier's Echo
line: "Keep the challengers coming and have them fight till the end... only by letting Nikador revel in the chaos of war can we control their descent into madness."

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Hmph, fabricating a spurious war in an attempt to calm the Titan. Nikador ... has indeed lost their will.

speaker: Castorice
line: This barbaric method of theirs clearly proved to be effective.

speaker: Castorice
line: The soul... can reveal even more to us.

speaker: Castorice
line: *cough* *cough*

speaker: Gnaeus
line: What's wrong, girl?

speaker: Castorice
line: Guiding souls takes a lot of energy... but I'm fine, Lord Gnaeus.

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Castorice
line: O, restless soul... *cough* Tell us, what have you heard?

speaker: Aristocrat's Echo
line: "How much longer is this festival going to last? What is King Eurypon waiting for?"

speaker: Advisor's Echo
line: "Be patient, for our plan is still underway... Sealing a Titan's soul is no easy endeavor . The priests are already working as fast as they can..."

speaker: Aristocrat's Echo
line: "Priests captured from other city-states — who can guarantee their loyalty? Hmph, I say we punish one of them so they know to behave..."

speaker: Castorice
line: Sealing a Titan's soul...

speaker: Castorice
line: Could it be the Sword Vessel in Lipos ' ballad? The one that Chartonus crafted himself...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Foolishness... Perhaps now you begin to understand the weight of that term.

text: Why are they doing this?

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: Out of cowardice. They are afraid of losing their faith and guidance.

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: Nikador fights against the unseen, they have no time for the folly of mortals.

text: So Nikador is at their mercy?

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: They are fighting against the unseen, they have no time for the folly of mortals.

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: Cowards... They are afraid of losing their faith and guidance.

speaker: Castorice
line: Lord Gnaeus, you seem to know a lot about that Titan.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: The whispers I'm hearing may very well be from Nikador themself.

speaker: Castorice
line: They're beckoning to us from the other side... Continue to guide us through, O wandering soul.

speaker: Castorice
line: *cough* *cough*

speaker: Castorice
line: The next one... I need to last till... the next one.

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Castorice
line: Lost souls... Tell us...

speaker: Castorice
line: *cough* *cough* *cough*

text: Is this one taking more out of you?
Do you need a break, Castorice?

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ I... I'm fine, ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer). There's no need to worry.

speaker: Castorice
line: Lost souls... Tell us, what have you heard?

speaker: Soldier's Echo
line: "Have you heard? King Eurypon's advisors are coming up with a plan to launch an all-out attack on Okhema."

speaker: Craftsman's Echo
line: "With just the handful of soldiers we have? They're absolutely out of their minds..."

speaker: Soldier's Echo
line: "That's the long-term plan. Our priority for now is still to complete the god-king's... 'project'."

speaker: Castorice
line: So their plan to attack Okhema was conceived that long ago?

text: Looks like it wasn't Nikador's idea...
Whoever hatched that plan must've long since turned to ash.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: I knew it.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Lord Gnaeus?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: I've long suspected that you two are not from here... No, not just that. You're not from this era.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Is it Oronyx ? No... they would not be capable of such power.

text: Yikes, our cover's blown...!
Looks like we'll have to silence him for good!

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ Calm yourself, ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer)... I believe he has no ill intent toward us.

speaker: Castorice
line: Your guess is correct, Lord Gnaeus... *cough* We are not from this era.

speaker: Castorice
line: Some day in the distant future... a mad Nikador will drive our companions and our homeland to the brink of destruction. The reason we came back here... is to find a way to prevent Amphoreus from falling to its doom.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: ...Their madness will last for thousands of years? The destruction created by human folly is more than anyone could imagine. It so happens that we have the same goal.

speaker: Castorice
line: *cough* *cough* The souls... are still lingering here. Let us keep going...

speaker: Castorice
line: *cough* *cough* *cough*

speaker: Gnaeus
line: ...Don't push yourself.

speaker: Castorice
line: We're almost at the end... I can sense it...

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Castorice
line: O, restless soul...

text: Castorice...
Why don't you take a break...?

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ I'm fine... ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer).

speaker: Castorice
line: Lost souls... Tell us, what have you heard?

speaker: Hero's Echo
line: "Courage, Honor, Tenacity, and Sacrifice. Their divinity was split into five parts... but we're missing one fragment."

speaker: Hero's Echo
line: "Oh god-king... Where did you lose your reason ?"

speaker: Hero's Echo
line: "We will keep searching for it. We must find it..."

speaker: Castorice
line: *cough* *cough* *cough*

speaker: Castorice
line: *cough*... I never knew ferrying souls stuck in limbo could bring this much pain...

speaker: Castorice
line: If only death didn't exist in this world. That way, they wouldn't have to linger here... and I wouldn't have to suffer.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: ...You don't have to listen to these spirits any longer. We've learned enough from them now. The people of Kremnos have tampered with Nikador 's soul in some way. What we need to do is find the place of their blasphemous act.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Stay strong. We have not reached the end yet.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...I'll be fine. Just give me a few moments... Let me send this lost soul into the gentle embrace of death.

speaker: Castorice
line: The other side is beckoning to you... Go on, lost soul, rest in peace...

speaker: Castorice
line: That... will do.

text: Proceed deeper into Castrum Kremnos and search for clues about Nikador

speaker: Castorice
line: I am sorry... that you had to witness my earlier outburst.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: I understand your pain, child. But you need to set it aside for now.

text: (Halfway down the stairs between the double gates)

speaker: Gnaeus
line: We are nearing the place where they cast and cut the souls.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: It is likely no one survived this far in the festival. Stay alert.

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Castorice
line: The Titan's kin... Be careful.

speaker: Furiae Praetor
line: Warrior...

speaker: Furiae Praetor
line: Entry... forbidden...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Has it lost its sanity? What a woeful creation. I shall put it out of its misery.

speaker: Furiae Praetor
line: Split... soul...

speaker: Furiae Praetor
line: Indestructible... body...!

text: (Begin battle againstFuriae Archer×2,Furiae Troupe×1,Furiae Praetor×1,Furiae Philosopher×1)
(After the battle)

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Is it dealt with?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: No... I doubt it'll be that simple.

speaker: Furiae Praetor
line: Split... soul...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: An experiment...

text: What do you mean?
An experiment?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: King Eurypon wanted to strip Nikador of his divinity and seal it within an intricate vessel for all eternity.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: That's how he would immortalize Nikador 's divine body... Of course, he had to test it out on a Titankin before going on to remold the Titan.

text: How are you so sure about it?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: The answer's very simple...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: ...Because the fragments of Nikador 's soul are sealed in these statues. The calls that I've been hearing... are coming from them.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: As long as we reassemble their soul and unite their divine core, they will recover their dignity as a Titan. You will then have a chance to triumph over them in battle.

speaker: Furiae Praetor
line: Indestructible... body...

speaker: Castorice
line: We've finally found the root of everything...

speaker: Castorice
line: I'll find a way to stall it. To Titankin that have lost all reason, death is as intoxicating as nectar is to bees.

speaker: Castorice
line: Please, you must find a way to make Nikador 's soul whole again. It is only by fixing this point in history... that we can salvage the future of Amphoreus.

text: We can tap into the power of time again.
Ready to travel through time, gladiator?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Let's see what you can do, delver of memories.

text: Use Oronyx's Miracle to switch space-time
(Talk to Castorice, optional)

speaker: Castorice
line: Stay here, warrior... Do not leave your Goddess of Death. The enticing scent of blood here is meant for you, and only you...

speaker: Furiae Praetor
line: Sweet... death.

speaker: Furiae Praetor
line: Inner... peace.

text: (Use Oronyx's Miracle)

speaker: Gnaeus
line: ...Unbelievable.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: This dark and derelict place... is this the future of Kremnos?

text: I can barely believe it myself.

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: The resonance between you and Oronyx must be strong.

text: Kremnos must have been through a lot since then...

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: History has taken a wrong turn... and must be set on the right course once more.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Much time has passed, yet the Titan's soul remains fragmented. That covetous king and his servants would have turned to dust by now... Their scheme that once unfolded here has likewise been buried with them.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: You and I are both here to bring an end to this absurdity. So, join me comrade. Let us bring death unto that Titan.

text: Head to the Soul-Forging Platform
(Approach the marked location)

speaker: Gnaeus
line: The sounds of battle. That's...

text: From a time dimension very close to ours...
...My companions fighting against Nikador.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: So, there are mortals who fight against fate even in this hopelessly bleak era. I am impressed.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: But strength alone will not help them destroy an immortal body... That's why you and that girl went back in time seeking answers.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: "Courage."

speaker: Gnaeus
line: "Honor."

speaker: Gnaeus
line: "Tenacity."

speaker: Gnaeus
line: "Sacrifice."

speaker: Gnaeus
line: "Reason."

speaker: Gnaeus
line: There are only four soul-forged statues here. If they did split Nikador 's divinity into five parts, there is still one fragment of the soul that is missing.

text: Let's just start with these first.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Agreed.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Come, help me piece together Strife's divinity.

text: Nikador's soul has been severed into 4 parts by the Kremnoans and is sealed into the 4 statues in the Soul-Forging Zone. Insert the giant swords in these statues' hands into the base to release one fragment of Nikador's divinity. Nikador's soul has been severed into 4 parts by the Kremnoans and is sealed into the 4 statues in the Soul-Forging Zone. Insert the giant swords in these statues' hands into the base to release one fragment of Nikador's divinity. Use the Hand of Zagreus to grab the charging device and place it at the foot of the statue . Then, use Oronyx's Prayer to rewind space-time, letting the giant sword in the statue's hand return to a complete state, and activate the statue. Statues that are broken can be completed by shining the light of the Miracle Orbs . Use the Hand of Zagreus to grab the charging device and place it at the foot of the statue . Then, use Oronyx's Prayer to rewind space-time, letting the giant sword in the statue's hand return to a complete state, and activate the statue. Statues that are broken can be completed by shining the light of the Miracle Orbs . After all four statues in the Night space-time are activated, you can break the shackles on Nikador's divinity and advance the story. After all four statues in the Night space-time are activated, you can break the shackles on Nikador's divinity and advance the story.
Return the Soul-Forging Statue to its rightful place
(Approach the marked location)

speaker: Gnaeus
line: I can hear... I hear it.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: A part of Nikador 's divinity is sealed within this...

text: (Use Oronyx's Prayer to rewind time on the sword)

speaker: Festival Noise
line: "We shall hereby seal the god-king's Courage within this sword vessel."

speaker: Festival Noise
line: "A testament that they have never once retreated from a battle."

speaker: Festival Noise
line: "Even against the formless black tide from beyond the dense fog, they alone have raised their sword and faced the enemy head-on..."

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Nikador 's Courage...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Break free from your shackles and return to your divine body.

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Gnaeus
line: The voices... are starting to pour in.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Here lies another fragment of Nikador 's divinity...

text: (Use Oronyx's Prayer to rewind time on the sword first, optional)
The Sword of the Soul-Forging Statue failed to return to its original place. Something is still missing here.
Perhaps you should try using the Hand of Zagreus to restore the statue's base.
(Successfully use Oronyx's Prayer to rewind time on the sword)

speaker: Festival Noise
line: "We shall hereby seal the god-king's Honor within this sword vessel."

speaker: Festival Noise
line: "A testament that they have never plunged their divine lance into an enemy's back."

speaker: Festival Noise
line: "Even when enemies close in from all sides, they have never conceded to evil schemes, fiercely guarding the warrior's dignity..."

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Nikador 's Honor...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Break free from your shackles and return to your divine body.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: I am listening...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Go on... Tell me your tale.

text: (Use Oronyx's Prayer to rewind time on the sword first, optional)
The Sword of the Soul-Forging Statue failed to return to its original place. Something is still missing here. Upon close inspection, you notice the body of the statue is incomplete.
Perhaps you should try using the Oronyx Orb to reflect its whole body.
(Successfully use Oronyx's Prayer to rewind time on the sword)

speaker: Festival Noise
line: "We shall hereby seal the god-king's Tenacity within this sword vessel."

speaker: Festival Noise
line: "A testament that their will is unyielding in the fight against the calamity of unknown origin."

speaker: Festival Noise
line: "No matter how powerful the black tide may be, enough to corrupt the wills of other gods, they stand tall and upright in defiance of the turbulent fog, even till today..."

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Nikador 's Tenacity...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Break free from your shackles and return to your divine body.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Divinity exists within this statue.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Tell me everything that happened here...

text: (Successfully use Oronyx's Prayer to rewind time on the sword and return to the correct space-time state)

speaker: Festival Noise
line: "We shall hereby seal the god-king's Sacrifice within this sword vessel."

speaker: Festival Noise
line: "A testament that their final words before sinking into dormancy were a vow to defend the world against the black tide."

speaker: Festival Noise
line: "They use their own body as our city walls, keeping out and protecting us from the pervasive spread of madness. They are acutely aware that if the end times were to arrive, there would be nothing left in this world to conquer..."

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Nikador 's Sacrifice...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Break free from your shackles and return to your divine body.

text: Is... that it?

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: Hm... We're now left with the final missing fragment of divinity.

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: I believe I know where it is.

text: Where could the missing fragment of divinity be?

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: I was wrong all this while. The final fragment of divinity was never lost...

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: I believe I know where it is.

text: (Optional) Seek Gnaeus's Help

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Come, help me piece together Strife's divinity.

text: I have no clue, what can I do? (Skip puzzle)

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: There's no trace... Let's just start with these first.

children.text: (Immediately repairs all remaining Soul-Forging Statues and triggers their associated dialogue)

text: No worries, let me ponder on it a bit more...
Time for a decisive battle with Nikador!

title: Step Description
content: Gnaeus turns out to be a part of Nikador. Now aware of the agony of this world, he calmly merges with Nikador's long-decayed divine soul, fully completing Nikador. While that destroyed the god's immortality, it also means we're now face-to-face with a Titan at the peak of their power.

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Castorice
line: Lord Gnaeus, are we almost there?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Yes... There is just one last thing to do.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: No one knows when the black tide first appeared beyond the distant horizon, but when it slowly encroached upon Amphoreus's borders, Nikador was the first Titan to venture forth.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: During the battle against the black tide, their sanity began to slip away... In their prime, the Titan could obliterate an entire archipelago with a single slash, yet they could not sever the root of this corruption.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: They battled the black tide by sheer will alone, but ultimately succumbed to it. Before their divinity could be completely corrupted, they removed a part of it...

speaker: Castorice
line: Could it be...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: The fragment of divinity that they stripped away — the fragment they wanted to preserve the most — was Reason.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: The Titan believed that their Reason would someday respond to their calling, to return to their body... and fulfill their sacred mission.

text: Are all these... versions of you from the past?
You're... a part of Nikador?

speaker: Castorice
line: All of these... They're—

speaker: Gnaeus
line: They represent countless failed endeavors. With your help, I can finally put an end to everything.

speaker: Castorice
line: Lord Gnaeus... What do you intend to do?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Courage, Honor, Tenacity, and Sacrifice... they're all versions of me. Hearing the murmurs of these soul fragments has led me to a conclusion.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Nikador's soul is corrupted beyond the point of salvation.

text: What can we do then?

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: There is only one option.

text: How do we stop them then?

children.speaker: Gnaeus
children.line: There is only one way to do so.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: The seal that binds their divinity is already broken. As long as we complete the soul-forging here, Nikador will be whole once more.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: You will go into battle with a Titan nearly at the zenith of their powers. And when that happens, the glory of slaying a god will also be presented before you.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...What about you, Lord Gnaeus?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: I will return to where I came from and become a part of Nikador 's divinity once more.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: In all likelihood, I will also be consumed by corruption. An inevitable course of action if we hope to end this madness.

speaker: Castorice
line: You are willing to... sacrifice yourself for a future you won't get to witness?

speaker: Gnaeus
line: This is my purpose, my origin. I am no mortal and I do not fear death... Even so, will you still weep for me?

speaker: Castorice
line: All farewells in this world are sorrowful, Lord Gnaeus.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: While we haven't known each other for long, I have learned much from you. In return, I'll teach you a lesson of mine before I go...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Do not detest your talent and do not abhor death. Journeys and epics are only glorious and magnificent because all things eventually fade to dust.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...The embodiment of Strife telling me about the majesty of the world...? What an irony...

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Civilizations only grow under strife. Humans instinctively loathe suffering, yet suffering is the only thing that teaches them to stand unyielding and tall...

text: We can't put this off any longer.
I will do as you wish.
If this is meant to be... then I will fight you.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: ▶ ( He / She ) knows what it truly means to go to battle. Perhaps ( he / she ) can be your inspiration.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: If you die by my lance, then there's no need to reflect on what I said. But if you should send me to my grave... promise me that you will use my Coreflame to fuel a roaring blaze and continue the fight against the black tide.

speaker: Castorice
line: On behalf of all the Chrysos Heirs, I... promise you.

speaker: Gnaeus
line: I am Nikador , the Lance of Fury, the messenger of turmoil, and the embodiment of Strife!

speaker: Gnaeus
line: Remember this: I am the scar that this world needs!

text: (Cutscene plays)

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Did you hear that?

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: What?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: They've returned!

children.speaker: Gnaeus/Nikador
children.line: Best me—

children.speaker: Gnaeus/Nikador
children.line: —Grant me an end befitting a warrior.

text: (Cutscene ends)
(Begin battle againstThe Giver, Master of Legions, Lance of Fury)

speaker: Phainon
line: So this is Nikador 's true form? It's incredible...

speaker: Mydei
line: Well done on them... I was prepared to fight till the end of time.

html_content:
<dl><dt>(Interactive tutorial)</dt>
<dd>Reducing the HP of "Conquer or Be Conquered" restores the corresponding character's Maximum Restorable HP</dd></dl>

text: (When The Giver, Master of Legions, Lance of Fury is reduced to below 40% HP)

speaker: Mydei
line: Since you've overcome the curse of immortality... destruction shall be your reward!

text:
(Second phase starts)
(When The Giver, Master of Legions, Lance of Fury takes a turn)

speaker: Castorice
line: I promise you, Lord Gnaeus...

speaker: Castorice
line: Your nightmare will be over soon.

text: (The Giver, Master of Legions, Lance of Fury uses The Fallen Feeds My Might)

speaker: Mydei
line: Brace yourselves. This strike can obliterate worlds.

text: (When The Giver, Master of Legions, Lance of Fury is reduced to below 40% HP once more)

speaker: Phainon
line: Come on, bring an end to Strife once and for all!

text: (When The Giver, Master of Legions, Lance of Fury is reduced to 1% HP)

speaker: Phainon
line: Victory is at hand! Time for the final blow...!

text: (Cutscene plays)

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Master—

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: —Now.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: No longer must one wield a sword...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: From here on, the world shall no longer know "strife."

text: (Cutscene ends)

speaker: Phainon
line: It's finally over.

speaker: Phainon
line: Nikador 's Coreflame...

speaker: Castorice
line: Time passes quickly. It's been a long time since the last Titan fell...

speaker: Castorice
line: Now that the Lance of Fury is no more, we Chrysos Heirs are one step closer to the genesis as foretold in the prophecy.

speaker: Mydei
line: The silence here is stifling... This city feels so unfamiliar now that its Titan is gone.

speaker: Phainon
line: You've exchanged thousands of blows with them... Your ears are probably just not used to this peace and quiet.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Hmph. What's next?

speaker: Castorice
line: I have an agreement with the Titan... The Chrysos Heirs will take away their Coreflame and use it to start a bright blaze that'll illuminate our path onward.

speaker: Phainon
line: You... spoke with Nikador ?

text: They were protecting the world from something.

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: What did they say? Please, I need to know...

text: There was something out there that sent them into madness.

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Something out there? Please, I need to know what it is...

speaker: Castorice
line: Not now, Lord Mydei. I'll tell you everything once we return to Okhema.

speaker: Phainon
line: Aglaea mentioned that... someone must touch the Coreflame and absorb it to become its temporary receptacle.

speaker: Phainon
line: Mydei, do you...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...This honor is yours. Isn't it something you've been longing for?

speaker: Phainon
line: But you're more deserving of it... You sustained all these new wounds from fighting them.

speaker: Mydei
line: If you have any idea how exhausting it is to fight a protracted battle...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Then you should know that pointless arguments are the last thing I want to get into now.

speaker: Phainon
line: Meh, a little back and forth wouldn't hurt much. Coming to a decision so easily makes it seem like this is not at all a life-changing undertaking, you know.

text: (Phainon approaches the coreflame)

speaker: Phainon
line: Come with me then, Coreflame. The Vortex of Genesis is awaiting your return.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Are you alright, Phainon?

speaker: Phainon
line: ...I don't think I felt anything at all.

speaker: Phainon
line: Or rather... it felt a lot easier than I expected? I had assumed that bearing the Coreflame would take... a lot more out of me.

speaker: Phainon
line: In any case, let's return to Okhema and share news of our victory with the two demigods .

text: (Mydei, Phainon, and Dan Heng depart)

speaker: Mem
line: Leave, friend? Return, together?

text: Aren't you coming with us, Castorice?
Did we forget something?
I will always remember Gnaeus.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Although he was but a part of Nikador ... he was nevertheless a hero in his own right.

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ Go with the rest, ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer). I will catch up with you later. I would like to talk to Lord Gnaeus again... one last time.

text: Castorice picks up a piece of Gnaeus 's fragments...
Media:Trailblaze Mission Kremnos, Cleanse Thy Rusted Blood (II).mp4

speaker: Castorice
line: Lord Gnaeus...

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Lord Nikador , can you hear me?

speaker: Castorice
line: I know that your only wish right now is to rest in peace. But you are the only one with answers to my deepest doubts... So, forgive me for disturbing you.

speaker: Castorice
line: Please, tell me... do you know where Thanatos is?

speaker: Castorice
line: I must find them. The half of me that I've been deprived of since birth ... I must take it back from them.

speaker: Nikador's Corpse
line: (Titan's fragmented voice)

speaker: Castorice
line: I see... So even the Strife Titan has never seen Death in the flesh.

speaker: Castorice
line: I will continue this arduous journey, even if I must travel to every corner of Amphoreus...

speaker: Nikador's Corpse
line: (Titan's fragmented voice)

speaker: Castorice
line: I understand... The Chrysos Heirs will fulfill the promise we made and see your unfinished work to its end.

speaker: Castorice
line: Such a peaceful end is not befitting of you, the bringer of Strife into this world... But it's a good thing it's just me here. No one else can see what you look like in the final moments of your life.

speaker: Castorice
line: Poets will still describe you as an embodiment of madness and corruption, the god of war who incinerated all of their glory. Yet, at this moment... I am willing to send you into the gentle embrace of death, to a sweet land full of blossoming flowers.

speaker: Castorice
line: Farewell, Titan.

text: Some time later...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Agy, they're back!

speaker: Phainon
line: We completed the mission, Tribbie! No broken limbs or severe injuries, just a fiery Coreflame in the palm of my hand.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I can feel the Coreflame's warmth... Well done, Phainon.

speaker: Aglaea
line: It has been far too long since Amphoreus last saw the birth of a demigod. Having you take Nikador 's place will surely invigorate the spirits of those in the holy city.

speaker: Phainon
line: I... want to be honest about this: I believe Mydei is the better candidate. He was once the crown prince of Kremnos after all, and much of his lifetime was spent fighting alongside Nikador .

speaker: Phainon
line: He is more worthy of the title of "Strife" than I am.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You have thought much about this, sweet child, but there is one thing you overlooked.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The qualities you've mentioned are very likely the reasons Mydeimos refused this Coreflame.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I do not doubt his strength and talents... In fact, he must have imagined himself becoming a god a thousand times over. But he turned it down because he does not want to lead his people down the same path again.

speaker: Aglaea
line: So I will ask you once more... Have you made up your mind, Phainon of Aedes Elysiae ?

speaker: Phainon
line: I am ready for this. I will shoulder the burden of divinity alongside the both of you... I am willing to make the necessary sacrifices.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Very good.

speaker: Tribbie
line: This day has finally come, Snowy. You've been wanting this all along, right?

speaker: Phainon
line: If the prophecy hadn't found me back then... I would still be roaming the world aimlessly. Right now though, I live for the sole purpose of dedicating myself to the mission of the Chrysos Heirs.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I never once doubted your resolve.

speaker: Aglaea
line: This time tomorrow, the Chrysos Heirs will gather at the Vortex of Genesis to surrender the Coreflame that once belonged to Nikador , the Lance of Fury.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Remember, this is unlike the unchanging rites our priests perform. No one knows the true cost a mortal must pay to accept Strife's divine authority. Your road ahead is still full of uncertainty.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Use this time to properly rest, Phainon.

speaker: Phainon
line: I understand. Until tomorrow, then.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It's so peaceful, as if nothing even happened.

text: We're protected by two demigods, after all.
There are others carrying the burden for them.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The people of Amphoreus must have extraordinary spirits to be able to enjoy their lives even in such troubled times.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...They have Aglaea and Tribbie to thank for that. It is because of their protection that the citizens are able to enjoy peace.

speaker: Phainon
line: Where did Mydei go?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: He was exhausted, so he already went back to rest.

speaker: Phainon
line: Our victory might not have been possible without your help. I'm sure you've heard enough words of gratitude, but it's only right that I—

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Right, it would be the first time I thanked you. So, thank you for your help, uh... Miss Mem?

text: What's next for us?

speaker: Phainon
line: Aglaea will gather us at the Vortex of Genesis this time tomorrow, where we'll perform a ritual to surrender the Coreflame.

speaker: Phainon
line: She only mentioned the Chrysos Heirs, but if I invite you two... I'm sure she'll welcome your presence.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Is there anything we should know about this ritual?

speaker: Phainon
line: From what Aglaea said, no one can predict what's going to happen, because each Titan's divine authority is unique. That's why I hope both of you can be there tomorrow. It'll bolster my confidence.

text: Aww, Phainon buddy, we've got your back.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Hahaha, that's settled then.

text: Oh, we charge a fee for appearances!

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Uh, that can be on Aglaea's tab. She's also known as the Goldweaver. Doesn't that name alone sound wealthy?

text: Sure, as long as we don't oversleep.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Hahaha, I'll be sure to send someone to wake you up then.

speaker: Phainon
line: The night's all yours, but get some rest before tomorrow's ritual. I should also take this time to sort out my thoughts... I'll see you soon, my friends.

text: You and Dan Heng watch Phainon leave the bath...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ Did you pick up on that, (Trailblazer)? He seems troubled.

text: Yeah, I did.
Pick up on what?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: You should start observing people's body language and their microexpressions. You can learn a lot from them.

text: How can you tell?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: From his body language and... microexpressions.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I guess it's understandable, seeing how he's about to experience something extraordinary. The Titans may only be the local gods of Amphoreus, but a mortal ascending to something else altogether... sounds like a lot to take in.

text: We have a lot to think about too.
About time we consider ourselves, too.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...You're right. So much happened in so short a time that we haven't had the time to consider our own predicament.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Our car's scrap, we've lost contact with the Crew , and everything beyond the sky is taboo here...

text: I'm gonna lose my login streak.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: It's a pity we can't send March a message, so she can help you finish your dailies.

text: Should've brought games we could play offline...

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...I do have some old-timey games with me, but I doubt you'd be interested.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Once Phainon's ascension ritual is over, we should start working out these problems of ours.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: For now though, let's just head back to the bath chamber to rest and gather ourselves.

text: Return to the private bath chamber and rest

title: Step Description
content: The battle with Nikador ends with the Chrysos Heirs' victory. We return to Okhema to rest and recover. Together, we will witness the return of the Titan's Coreflame and the start of the Coreflame's trial.

text: (Investigate the pile of rubble in the Soul-Forging Ruins, optional)
This place has been sealed off by the crumbled walls. The battlefield where you once faced Nikador has now become nothing more than a memory alongside the terrifying howls of battle.
(Approach the marked location)
Exhaustion envelops you... At this moment, no god of Amphoreus could pull your gaze away from this lounge chair.

speaker: Mem
line: Aww, are you sleepy? I can see your eyelids growing heavy~

speaker: Mem
line: Go to sleep then, if you're tired. Snoozy snooze... But isn't it always daytime in this city? How do you fall asleep like this...?

text: Wait... Something seems off...
...Did you notice?

speaker: Mem
line: Eep! I'll get embarrassed if you keep staring at me like that.

speaker: Mem
line: Are there... knots in my fur? Is it my ears? No, they seem fine. Look, I can even flap them!

text: ...You can say more than single words now!?
Wow, so you can speak in full sentences!

speaker: Mem
line: ...Hmm? You're right! I am speaking in full sentences now!

speaker: Mem
line: Wowie! It feels amazing being able to speak fluently! But... why do I speak in such a proper, un-cutesy manner now? I mean, referring to myself in standard first person and all.

text: Maybe it gives you more personality.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Personality...? Hmph, you're always saying things I don't understand!

text: Why aren't your words enunciated?

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Right!? You noticed too? Hmph, no fair!

text: Ew, phooey!

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: I didn't ask to be like this! No judging!

speaker: Mem
line: Hmph, never mind, since I'm the forgiving type. Besides, now that I'm a bit more used to it... I don't sound as bad?

text: Wait, who are you really?
So, can you tell me about yourself now?

speaker: Mem
line: Huh... I don't remember a thing about myself. Ugh, my head hurts.

speaker: Mem
line: I have a gut feeling, though! As long as we continue to collect the fragments of memories scattered across Amphoreus, we'll be rewarded with something really, really good.

speaker: Mem
line: How should I put it... Bah, anyway! I just know that this world is very important to me!

text: Sorry to burst your bubble, but I'm the protagonist here.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Then I'll be the protagonist's bestest sidekick, heehee! So give me more screen time, alright?

text: So, once again, it's all down to one ( guy / gal ) and ( his / her ) dog.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: I'm not a dog! Or a pet! I am...

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: ...Uh, what am I? A—Anyhow, I'm an important character for sure!

text: We're an ensemble cast.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Then I'll be the protagonist's bestest sidekick, heehee! So give me more screen time, alright?

speaker: Mem
line: Hnngh... I think I'm getting sleepy. The light feels so nice and warm. Even my fur's toasty warm. I can fall asleep any...

text: I'll take a break too...

speaker: Mem
line: Zzz... Zzz...

text: Your consciousness sinks into dreams, and at the edge of the dreamscape, you hear a whisper...
(Tutorials on how to useAs I've Written)
Open this book,
I'll be waiting for you in the past.
Light up the starry sky till the book appears in your hands
Having learned about Castrum Kremnos' past, now drop in that strand of "Nameless Recollection"
Record Mydeimos' story on the empty pages
The Flame-Chaser's Path has been lit
(Within the book)
(Tutorial on how to use As I've Written)
Wake up. Continue the journey, till that "Nameless Recollection" resurfaces
While you were having the strange dream, somewhere else in Okhema...

speaker: Castorice
line: You should take this opportunity to rest, Lord Phainon... The Coreflame ritual is tomorrow.

speaker: Phainon
line: Today, tomorrow, what difference does it make? It's always morning in Okhema under Kephale 's protection.

speaker: Phainon
line: So long as the light continues to shine this brightly, I won't be getting any sleep. Why force myself to shut my eyes when I can instead take this time to calm my mind and gather my thoughts? That counts as rest too.

speaker: Castorice
line: Have you... thought things through then?

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Not at all. Everything's a jumbled mess still. I don't even know where to start.

speaker: Phainon
line: The Coreflame was blazing hot in my palm in the beginning, but it has completely cooled off now... I can barely feel it.

speaker: Phainon
line: Miss Castorice... Does this mean I'm a good match for Nikador ?

speaker: Castorice
line: I don't quite get how it works, but if it's going to put you at ease... then I will say yes to that.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Thank you.

speaker: Phainon
line: That's the Abyss in the distance... Oh, that reminds me of the question I didn't get to ask.

speaker: Phainon
line: Back in the temple with the Scales of Justice, when Oronyx was trying to deter us... Why did you stop me, Miss Castorice?

speaker: Castorice
line: Because I knew there must be another solution. "Something more important than the fate of Amphoreus"... It is far too cruel and unfair to ask that of you.

speaker: Phainon
line: You should know that I would've gone ahead if Dan Heng hadn't come up with an answer in time.

speaker: Castorice
line: I know. We should not have hesitated then. I stopped you before I even realized it myself...

speaker: Castorice
line: ...It's fortunate we had the both of them there with us.

speaker: Phainon
line: Yeah, it's a good thing we had them.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Are you still thinking about the past , Lord Phainon?

speaker: Phainon
line: Every waking moment.

speaker: Phainon
line: I lied to the two demigods just now. I told them the duty of the Chrysos Heirs is all I think about now. Do you think I managed to slip by Aglaea's golden threads this time?

speaker: Castorice
line: No one fools her, Lord Phainon. She merely chooses to turn a blind eye to our lies.

speaker: Phainon
line: You're right. How foolish of me to think I got away with it.

speaker: Phainon
line: I often wonder if someone as ordinary as me can really become a hero. I thought defeating Nikador would quell the voice of doubt in my mind... but it has only grown louder.

speaker: Castorice
line: I don't have the right words for you now, but... I know you're far from ordinary, Lord Phainon. Mydei often calls you "Deliverer" in jest, but I don't believe he means it mockingly.

speaker: Phainon
line: I should probably shut out these pointless thoughts and empty my mind until the hour of the ritual...

speaker: Phainon
line: I did that before sitting for Tribbie's history exam — who in the world could hope to go over those piles of documents and slates? I decided I was better off resigning myself to fate. That way I'd get more time to play and practice with my sword.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...How did you do on the exam then?

speaker: Phainon
line: My score? I don't remember anymore. All I remember is Tribbie punishing me to a full week of cleaning the Chrysos Heirs' bath. And no one was allowed to help me.

speaker: Castorice
line: So High Priest Tribbie can be strict too...

speaker: Castorice
line: Please continue with this mentality, Lord Phainon. I believe you'll be alright.

speaker: Phainon
line: Thank you, Miss Castorice. I think I'll stay here for a little while and keep all of those unruly thoughts out. It's not like anything will come of them, anyway.

speaker: Phainon
line: The sights of Aedes Elysiae — my homeland — have been flashing before my eyes lately.

speaker: Phainon
line: Those Kremnoans mastered some cutting-edge technology... If only I could separate my soul from my body too. That way, I'd be able to fly my soul back to the comforting fields of my homeland any time.

speaker: Phainon
line: That's the only place I can be momentarily at peace...

text: Herta is preparing at the space station to commune with Nous the Aeon , but it seems the process didn't go so well?
